Will a summer of heat and wildfires revive France's climate policies?
description: After months of environmental policies being scaled back, climate-related disasters have come to dominate public debate. The question now is whether elected officials will remain concerned, particularly as budget discussions approach.

Italy's Salvini renews attacks on Macron
description: Two days after the French Foreign Ministry summoned Italy's ambassador, the Italian deputy prime minister doubled down on his criticism of the French president, portraying him as a warmonger over the Ukrainian issue.

headline: French Riviera town unveils monument equating Nazism and Communism, fueling protests
description: Saint-Raphaël's right-wing mayor, no stranger to media stunts, has vowed to 'put an end to the lies about the reality of communist totalitarianism.' In response, the French Communist Party and other left-wing groups denounced the 'revisionism of history.'

headline: Financial markets had a euphoric summer. Are they too optimistic?
description: Wall Street and European stock exchanges have been hitting record highs. The impact of trade tensions has been downplayed, and corporate earnings have pleasantly surprised investors. Still, valuations remain a cause for concern.

headline: The twilight of Morocco's King Mohammed VI
description: 'The Enigma of Mohammed VI' (1/6). Twenty-six years after his 1999 coronation, the Moroccan monarch's relationship to power remains complex. As questions about his health arise, the prospect of his succession is fueling power struggles and backroom deals among the country's elite.

description: Faced with the challenge of housing the residents of highly touristic or attractive cities, some mayors have decided to ban the construction of new vacation properties.

headline: In Iowa, soul-searching Democrats want revenge
description: In a rural state that swung Republican in 2016, Democrats are trying to unite those angered by cuts to welfare programs.

headline: Is 'abundance' the new watchword of US Democrats?
description: Born in California, the concept of 'abundance' has captivated the centrist wing of the Democratic Party. It advocates for an interventionist state paired with deregulation to facilitate investment and increase the supply of essential goods such as housing, energy, transportation and healthcare.
